review_blob: Not bad but nothing to write home about. Malt completely over powers the hops. Its good, just not really my idea of an IPA, but it is a pretty good ale.
Really nice aroma and flavor. I would expect more malt backbone but Im not disappointed as it lets the great hop selection shine thru.

I really like this. A beer to sip and savor. Kind of reminds me of nibbling on a rum filled cherry wrapped in dark chocolate. Perfect beverage to savor as I watch the snow fly outside. Good job great divide !!
A great session beer. Flavorful. Pairs well with any kind of bar food. Always a solid choice.
Head starts off with large quantity of frothy foam from large bottle. Dissipates quickly with lots of lace. Very powerful malt and hop flavor with plenty of warming booze quality.
beer_name: Uinta Detour Double India Pale Ale

review_blob: Nice balance of malt and hop flavors. Not over the top on either. Very drinkable. Always a wise choice to have one, when available.
The standard of pumpkin ales in my opinion. Cant go wrong with it. Usually the first and last pumpkin ale of the season that I see.
Lots of fruity sweetness with a nice alcohol burn. Cherry notes linger long after the sip. Delicious !!
An good example of a nice Brown ale. Not necessarily my thing but since its Bells, I had to try it. I was not disappointed.
An easy drinking stout. Nice subtle bourbon flavor, nothing over powering. Very enjoyable.
Wow. How awesome is this ? Take a sip and let all the flavors wash over in groups. Amazing !
Wow...does taste kind of buttery. Buttery, but does have a nice IPA flavor. Bit flat on draft.
Really enjoyed sharing a bottle of this. Very hoppy with wonderful hint of granola. They nailed this one !
I picked up a six of this in DE a few years ago and loved it. Hippy, malty, amazing. Picked up another six for thanksgiving and its missing a lot of the hoppiness. Still a great session IPA though.
Bottle of 2011. Fantastic all around stout. Beautiful dark foam on deep black beer. No off flavors.

I remember liking this a whole lot more, on tap, at fat heads in Pittsburgh. In a bottle Im not as impressed. Still very good IPA, but not earth shattering. Lots of sediment is a turn off for me also. I will try this one again someday and see if this bottle is just an anomaly.
Absolutely disgusting. I love IPA s. This does not taste like hop bittering. Tastes like they brewed it with a overdose of saccharin. Eck!
I picked this just because I like to try as many IPA s as I can. Very weak all around. Not a bad beer , just not a craft beer. I bet this would be just fine with some hot wings though.
The grapefruit notes come flying thru. A great IPA ! I might prefer a little more malt backbone, but there are other IPAs for that. Domo origato Ghandi bot
